Package http.server

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • http.server.WebServer
  • public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Example program from Chapter 1 Programming Spiders, Bots and Aggregators in Java Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton WebServer is a very simple web-server. Any request is responded with a very simple web-page.

      • httpGetMethode

        protected void httpGetMethode​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream dataOut,
                              java.lang.String filename)
        This method returns de requested resource filename correct gives 200 OK
        Parameters:
        dataOut - is the output stream for client socket
        filename - is the name of the file requested
        Throws:
        internalE - gives 500 Internal Server Error filename incorrect gives 404 Not Found

      • httpHeadMethode

        protected void httpHeadMethode​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream dataOut,
                               java.lang.String filename)
        This method checks the resource existance filename correct gives 200 OK
        Parameters:
        dataOut - is the output stream for client socket
        filename - is the name of the file requested
        Throws:
        internalE - gives 500 Internal Error filename incorrect gives 404 Not Found

      • httpDeleteMethode

        protected void httpDeleteMethode​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream dataOut,
                                 java.lang.String filename)
        This method deletes de requested resource on the server filename correct and file deleted give 204 No Content
        Parameters:
        dataOut - is the output stream for client socket
        filename - is the name of the file requested
        Throws:
        internalE - gives 500 Internal Error filename incorrect gives 404 Not Found file not deleted and missing rights give 403 Forbidden

      • httpPutMethode

        protected void httpPutMethode​(java.io.BufferedInputStream dataIn,
                              java.io.BufferedOutputStream dataOut,
                              java.lang.String filename)
        This method creates a file and adds the given ressource content to the new file or overwrites on an existing file with same pathname file overwritten gives 200 OK
        Parameters:
        dataIn - is the input stream from client socket
        dataOut - is the output stream for client socket
        filename - is the name of the file requested
        Throws:
        internalE - gives 500 Internal Error file created gives 201 Created

      • httpPostMethode

        protected void httpPostMethode​(java.io.BufferedInputStream dataIn,
                               java.io.BufferedOutputStream dataOut,
                               java.lang.String filename)
        This method appends data on a file to the given pathname or creates the file if doesn't exist data appened gives 200 OK
        Parameters:
        dataIn - is the input stream from client socket
        dataOut - is the output stream for client socket
        filename - is the name of the file requested
        Throws:
        internalE - gives 500 Internal Error file created gives 201 Created

      • headerStringifier

        protected java.lang.String headerStringifier​(java.lang.String filename,
                                             long fileLength,
                                             java.lang.String status,
                                             java.lang.String message)
        This method creates a string for the header with content-type and length...
        Parameters:
        fileLength - is the length of the file requested
        filename - is the name of the file to header stringify
        status - is the status code for the header
        message - is the message corresponding to the status
        Returns:
        the string header
